nodes.text: Hoylin was a world located in the Hoylin system, a part of the Fei Hu sector in the Slice portion of the Mid Rim. It was situated on the Gamor Run hyperlane, which connected it to the Aikhibba and Beris systems.

The Human spy Rodin Baem was born at Hoylin in 23 BBY, a fact which was noted in 7 ABY by New Republic General Airen Cracken in Wanted by Cracken, a datafile that served as a compilation of reports on various threats to the New Republic.

Hoylin was mentioned in the 1993 sourcebook Wanted by Cracken, which was written by Louis J. Prosperi for West End Games' Star Wars: The Roleplaying Game. The 2009 reference book The Essential Atlas placed the Hoylin system, and therefore Hoylin itself, in grid square P-13.
